metachat.pl.plot_group_communication_compare_hierarchy_diagram

metachat.pl.plot_group_communication_compare_hierarchy_diagram(adata_A, adata_B, condition_name_A=None, condition_name_B=None, database_name=None, group_name=None, metabolite_name=None, metapathway_name=None, customerlist_name=None, permutation_spatial=False, p_value_cutoff=0.05, node_sizes_limit=(50, 300), edge_sizes_limit=(0.5, 10), cmap=None, alpha=0.5, figsize=(10, 3), plot_savepath=None, ax=None)[source]

Plot hierarachy diagram for comparing group-level MCC between two conditions. The metabolic cell communication should have been computed by the function mc.tl.metabolic_communication(). The metabolic cell communication for some specific metabolite, metabolic pathway and customerlist should have been summarized by the function mc.tl.summary_communication(). The group-level metabolic cell communication flow should have been computed by the function mc.tl.communication_group() or mc.tl.communication_group_spatial().

Parameters:

  • adata_A (AnnData) – The data matrix of shape n_obs × n_var for condition A. Rows correspond to cells or positions and columns to genes.

  • adata_B (AnnData) – The data matrix of shape n_obs × n_var for condition B. Rows correspond to cells or positions and columns to genes.

  • condition_name_A (Optional[str]) – Name of condition A.

  • condition_name_B (Optional[str]) – Name of condition B.

  • database_name (Optional[str]) – Name of the Metabolite-Sensor interaction database.

  • group_name (Optional[str]) – Group name of the cell annotation previously saved in adata.obs.

  • metabolite_name (Optional[str]) – Name of a specific metabolite to detect response genes. For example, metabolite_name = ‘HMDB0000148’.

  • metapathway_name (Optional[str]) – Name of a specific metabolic pathways to detect response genes. For example, metabolite_name = ‘Alanine, aspartate and glutamate metabolism’.

  • customerlist_name (Optional[str]) – Name of a specific customerlist to detect response genes. For example, customerlist_name = ‘CustomerA’.

  • permutation_spatial (bool) – Whether to use results from mc.tl.communication_group_spatial.

  • p_value_cutoff (float) – Significance thresholds for Group-level MCC to plot.

  • node_sizes_limit (tuple) – Control the limit of the node size.

  • edge_sizes_limit (tuple) – Control the limit of the edge size.

  • group_cmap – A dictionary that maps group names to colors.

  • alpha (float) – Transparency of insignificant edges

  • figsize (tuple) – Fig size to plot the diagram.

  • plot_savepath (Optional[str]) – Filename for saving the figure. Set the name to end with ‘.pdf’ or ‘png’ to specify format.

  • ax (Optional[Axes]) – An existing matplotlib ax (matplotlib.axis.Axis).

Returns:

ax – The matplotlib ax object of the plot.

Return type:

matplotlib.axis.Axis
